BezierWire.name: BezierWire
BezierWire.description: Extend CanvasWire to draw a bezier curve using a canvas

params.name: config
params.description: the configuration for the BezierWire attributes

CanvasNode.name: CanvasNode
CanvasNode.description: TODO: Fix Resize issue on canvas

CanvasWire.name: CanvasWire
CanvasWire.description: Plugin for Wire to use a canvas element to render the wire

params.name: config
params.description: the configuration for the WireCanvasPlugin attributes

Container.name: Container
Container.description:
Container is an Overlay (XY positioning)
It is a WidgetChild (belongs to Layer)
It is also a WidgetParent (has many terminals)

ContainerBase.name: ContainerBase
ContainerBase.description:
ContainerBase is an Overlay (XY positioning)
It is a WidgetChild (belongs to Layer)
It is also a WidgetParent (has many terminals)

FormContainer.name: FormContainer
FormContainer.description:
Include the form library inputEx + WirableField + FormContainer

WARNING: The "WirableField.js" file MUST be loaded AFTER "inputEx/field.js" and BEFORE all other inputEx fields !

See the inputEx website for documentation of the fields & forms: http://neyric.github.com/inputex
Class used to build a container with inputEx forms

params.name: layer
params.description: The Y.Layer (or subclass) instance that contains this container

ImageContainer.name: ImageContainer
ImageContainer.description:
ImageContainer is an Overlay (XY positioning)
It is a WidgetChild (belongs to Layer)
It is also a WidgetParent (has many terminals)

InOutContainer.name: InOutContainer
InOutContainer.description: Container with left inputs and right outputs

BaseField.name: BaseField
BaseField.description: Copy of the original inputEx.Field class that we're gonna override to extend it.

Field.name: Field
Field.description: Class to make inputEx Fields "wirable".Re-create inputEx.Field adding the wirable properties

Layer.name: Layer
Layer.description: Layer : Widget to manage collections of wires (through WiresDelegate) and containers (trough WidgetParent)

Terminal.name: Terminal
Terminal.description: Terminal is responsible for wire edition

params.name: oConfigs
params.description: The user configuration for the instance.

TerminalBase.name: TerminalBase
TerminalBase.description: Terminal is responsible for wire edition

params.name: oConfigs
params.description: The user configuration for the instance.

TerminalInput.name: TerminalInput
TerminalInput.description: Class that extends Terminal to differenciate Input/Output terminals

TerminalOutput.name: TerminalOutput
TerminalOutput.description: Class that extends Terminal to differenciate Input/Output terminals

Y.WireTextareaContainer.name: Y.WireTextareaContainer
Y.WireTextareaContainer.description:
Form container for a single textarea field which is resizeable. 
Important: this class takes the exact same arguments as the FormContainer !
You still need to specify the "fields".

params.name: layer
params.description: The Y.Layer (or subclass) instance that contains this container

WireBase.name: WireBase
WireBase.description:
The wire widget
The wire is drawn between "src" and "tgt" (so they might be directional).

"src" and "tgt" MUST have a "getXY" function

"src" and "tgt" MAY additionnaly have the "addWire", "removeWire" methods.
Those methods are designed to be used through the Y.WiringsDelegate extension,
which provide basic list-handling on wires.

params.name: oConfigs
params.description: The user configuration for the instance.

WiresDelegate.name: WiresDelegate
WiresDelegate.description:
WiresDelegate is an extension for Widgets to manipulate a list of wires.

The WidgetParent/WidgetChild relationship isn't sufficient
because wires have 2 parents, so we use this extension instead of WidgetParent

The canvas is made bigger to contain the curls

classitems.description: cap attribute of the line ("round","butt", or "square")
classitems.name: cap

classitems.description: Get a terminal by name
classitems.name: getTerminal

classitems.description: This funtion is assigned to the <canvas> elements as element.getContext().

Binds a function to an object. The returned function will always use the
passed in {@code obj} as {@code this}.

Example:

  g = bind(f, obj, a, b)
  g(c, d) // will do f.call(obj, a, b, c, d)

params.name: f
params.description: The function to bind the object to

params.name: obj
params.description:
The object that should act as this when the function
    is called

params.name: var_args
params.description:
Rest arguments that will be used as the initial
    arguments when the function is called

return.description: A new function that has bound this

classitems.description:
Public initializes a canvas element so that it can be used as canvas
element from now on. This is called automatically before the page is
loaded but if you are creating elements using createElement you need to
make sure this is called on the element.

This class implements CanvasRenderingContext2D interface as described by
the WHATWG.

params.name: surfaceElement
params.description:
The element that the 2D context should
be associated with
